individual_metadata.synopsis: This is the dialogue each avatar gets when they wake up on the beach in WLD_Main_A Crash site.It's a call to action to find a solution for the tadpole before you turn into a mindflayer.

44.speaker: Narrator
44.text: *Sunlight. Your first instinct is to flinch from it and hide in the safety of shadows. But to your astonishment, there is no pain.*

34.speaker: Narrator
34.text: *The opposite, in fact. Your skin tingles pleasantly. Like the caress of a lover who doesn't know any better yet.*

60.speaker: Narrator
60.text: *But beneath the skin, flesh, and bone, there is a much more unpleasant sensation. Something nibbles and burrows where it does not belong. The tadpole, nestled in your brain.*

8.speaker: Player
8.text: Forget the parasite and savour the warmth of the sun. You are reborn.

59.speaker: Narrator
59.text: *Your stomach rudely announces itself to you with a twinge. Unfortunately, you cannot eat sunlight. Time you found some prey.*

67.speaker: Player
67.text: Just the thought of nibbling reminds you - it's high time you found some prey to sup on.

1.speaker: Narrator
1.text: *What delicacies might abound? Only one way to find out...*

6.speaker: Narrator
6.text: *And, of course, you'll be feeding for two now, thanks to your guest. Until it deigns to feast on your brains and split you open to reveal a newborn mind flayer...*

37.speaker: Narrator
37.text: *Perhaps it would be wise to focus on finding a cure. As wonderful as the sun is, you can hardly enjoy it if your face rips open.*

30.speaker: Player
30.text: Perhaps you are being too harsh. The tadpole gifted you the sun, after all...

71.speaker: Narrator
71.text: *But it will also bring transformation, given time. Into a mind flayer.*

57.speaker: Narrator
57.text: *Tentacles. Horror. Blood. Oblivion. Only some of those sound appealing.*

58.speaker: Narrator
58.text: *It hurts just to think, but you need to get your bearings. You went to Avernus as a hunter, but you've left it as prey. Not to devils, but to the tadpole in your brain.*

66.speaker: Player
66.text: Focus. You have a devil called Karlach to hunt.

52.speaker: Narrator
52.text: *Your mind doesn't want to cooperate. Every time you try to focus on the hunt before you, thoughts of the tadpole brush it aside. You have to find a cure.*

39.speaker: Player
39.text: Maybe your patron can help with the tadpole.

38.speaker: Narrator
38.text: *Perhaps. But you need to help her before she can return the favour. High time you got back to the hunt.*

23.speaker: Player
23.text: Removing the tadpole is all that matters now. Unless you find a cure, your hunting days are over.

63.speaker: Narrator
63.text: *Your patron might see things differently. But if the tadpole has its way, in a few days you won't be worrying about her or anything else.*

65.speaker: Player
65.text: Ye gods! Can it be... I'm... I'm...

24.speaker: Player
24.text: If it looks like the Sword Coast, smells like the Sword Coast, and feels like the fucking Sword Coast...
24.context: NodeContext: Karlach trying to suss if she's on the Sword Coast and realizing she is

9.speaker: Player
9.text: I did it. I got out.
9.context: NodeContext: A moment of awe/ emotion, realizing she did in fact escape Avernus at last.

47.speaker: Player
47.text: No doubt Zariel will be on my trail soon. Think I even spotted one of her hunters on the ship. I better get moving.

10.speaker: Player
10.text: Forget the hunter. I'm more afraid of the parasite in my head.

35.speaker: Player
35.text: Been through a lot, but I draw the line at becoming a mind flayer. I'll sort it. I always do.

17.speaker: Player
17.text: Forget the hunter and the parasite. I'm more concerned about the infernal engine burning out.

46.speaker: Player
46.text: Yeah, yeah, one crisis at a time, hm?

74.speaker: Player
74.text: Forget the hunter, the parasite, and the engine. I'M HOME, GODS DAMN IT! HOME!

21.speaker: Player
21.text: Yes. YES! Should be able to follow the river straight to Baldur's Gate. Easy.
21.context: NodeContext: Wonder and happiness that she's home at last.

77.speaker: Player
77.text: And not a devil to be found. This is it. I'm finally free.
77.context: NodeContext: A moment of awe/ emotion, realizing she did in fact escape Avernus at last.

72.speaker: Player
72.text: For good. Forever. No matter what.

31.speaker: Player
31.text: INFECTED BY A MIND FLAYER PARASITE!

20.speaker: Player
20.text: Better ten bugs than another day in the Hells. Than another hour.
20.context: NodeContext: Determined, glad to be free, unwilling to go back.

11.speaker: Player
11.text: Don't be daft. That parasite will turn me into a mind flayer if I don't find a cure.

27.speaker: Player
27.text: I'll sort it. I always do. Might even have a little fun bashing devil bootlickers along the way.

76.speaker: Player
76.text: Step one: get far away from anything with tentacles. Step two: stay calm and don't burn anything down. Step three: find allies who won't mind a friend who spends a lot of time talking to herself.
76.context: NodeContext: Last node in her first dialogue. She's relieved and happy but determined to make progress.

70.speaker: Player
70.text: Now - time to march. I've got a life to live. Finally.
70.context: NodeContext: Last node in her first dialogue. She's relieved and happy but determined to make progress.

64.speaker: Narrator
64.text: *Your head spins as you gather yourself. Fresh air and firm ground feel almost alien to you.*

22.speaker: Narrator
22.text: *But not as alien as the creature hiding deep inside your head. You must get rid of it.*

48.speaker: Player
48.text: The artefact. You need to make sure it's secure.

25.speaker: Narrator
25.text: *It's safe with you - Lady Shar's mission can still be fulfilled.*
25.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mimes checking something on her hip, out of frame. Expression relaxes.

14.speaker: Narrator
14.text: *But only if you can find a cure first. The tadpole must be evicted - be it by blade, magic, or any other means you can find.*

73.speaker: Player
73.text: Offer the Dark Lady silent thanks for your survival this far. Beg her for guidance.

16.speaker: Narrator
16.text: *You feel nothing. But of course, Lady Shar is no crass teacher, bludgeoning you with her instructions.*

69.speaker: Narrator
69.text: *She wants you to solve this on your own - prove yourself to her. First the parasite, then the mission. You are on the right track already.*

13.speaker: Narrator
13.text: *Despite your recent fall from the nautiloid, you are miraculously unharmed. Apart from the volatile orb of Netherese magic buried within your chest, of course.*
13.context: CinematicNodeContext: Small glance down towards chest/heart, concerned expression

61.speaker: Narrator
61.text: *It stirs softly. Soon it will hunger, and when that time comes it must be fed. Starve it, and you risk triggering a cataclysmic explosion of raw, unfettered Weave.*

75.speaker: Narrator
75.text: *Such an explosion will be unavoidable, if the tadpole in your skull triggers ceremorphosis. An outcome definitely best avoided.*

43.speaker: Player
43.text: You'll find a way to fix this. You are Gale of Waterdeep, after all.

51.speaker: Narrator
51.text: *That great mind is little more than a playground for a parasite right now. The tadpole must be disposed of.*

18.speaker: Narrator
18.text: *According to what you've read, you have but seven days to find a cure... or that's the end of you. Better get moving.*

62.speaker: Narrator
62.text: *It was indeed miraculous... and perhaps a little suspicious. But it will have been for nothing if you don't find a way to remove the tadpole. And quickly.*

3.speaker: Player
3.text: Recall everything you know about illithid tadpoles.

53.speaker: Narrator
53.text: *You know a good deal about illithids and the process known as ceremorphosis. None of it good.*

5.speaker: Narrator
5.text: *You half-expected your memories to return once you were free of the mind flayer ship, but your past is still an aching void.*

55.speaker: Narrator
55.text: *If you don't find a way to remove the tadpole burrowed in your brain soon, your future will be as blank as your past.*

50.speaker: Narrator
50.text: *Your head whispers vengeance: you cannot wait to slice your way forth, seeking whatever wrought this tragedy upon you.*

32.speaker: Narrator
32.text: *As you wake, the tadpole squirms in your skull.*

28.speaker: Narrator
28.text: *Other than the infection, you're more or less intact. A miracle, given everything you've been through.*

0.speaker: Narrator
0.text: *But it'll all be for nothing if you don't find help soon.*

36.speaker: Narrator
36.text: *The tadpole is a death sentence, and the clock is ticking. You need a cure.*

26.speaker: Player
26.text: Orient yourself - where did you land?

2.speaker: Narrator
2.text: *The chaos of the crash site confuses the landscape. You'll need to find a settlement or landmark.*
2.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player glances around general surrounds.

42.speaker: Narrator
42.text: *And you'll need to do it quickly.*

33.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player gets to their feet groggily.
